title: Save Up To $50 On Indiana Jones And The Great Circle Collector's Edition At Amazon
description: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle's Collector's Edition for PC (Steam) is discounted by up to $50 at Amazon. Everyone can take advantage of Amazon's deal that drops the price from $190 to $155.79. But select regions across the US, including the Midwest, can get an additional 10% off by clicking the coupon box below the price. With the coupon added, you'll see the price fall to $140.21 at checkout. Amazon's deal likely won't be available for long, and boxed copies of the game in general are becoming scarce at major retailers, as you'll see below. To be clear, the Steam version of the Collector's Edition naturally includes a code to redeem the $100 Premium Edition on PC, but you are getting several collectibles, including an oversized steelbook case. a globe with a hidden storage compartment and magnetic airplane, and an Adventure Journal of your own. Indiana Jones and the Great Circle Collector's Edition (Steam Key) $155.79 (was $190) | $140.21 if eligible for coupon. Here's what you get with Indiana Jones and the Great Circle's Collector's Edition:11-inch The Great Circle Globe with magnetic airplane and secret compartmentJumbo Steelbook Display CaseNew Adventure JournalDigital Premium Edition code on Allmaker Relic ReplicaDigital Premium Edition content: The Order of Giants Story DLC (upcoming)Temple of Doom OutfitDigital Art BookSteelbooks are pretty common these days, but Jumbo steelbook cases, well, leave it to Indy to unearth a rare find like this. And it's (the color) gold!Since the game's Premium Edition retails for $100, the physical collectibles normally cost an additional $90. With Amazon's deal, you're only paying $55.79--or $40, if eligible for the coupon--which is a pretty awesome deal. This promotion only applies to the PC edition of the game, which includes a Steam key.Walmart also has the Steam version of the Collector's Edition in stock, though it'll cost you $189.Note: The Order of Giants story expansion is still in development, but you'll have access to it when it drops. See at Amazon Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Fortnite OG Pass Season 4: All Skins And Rewards
description: The strangely lengthy Fortnite OG Season 3 has finally come to an end--it was three weeks longer than the first two!--and now it's finally time for the one we've all been waiting for. Season 4 was a landmark for Fortnite, and these days it's widely considered to be the season where Fortnite found its groove. And now we get to go back.Naturally, the new season of OG comes with a new OG Pass. Like the previous OG Passes, this one includes three skins inspired by Fortnite's history, along with a full set of cosmetics and multiple style options for each of them. And, yes, this pass does include a remix of a certain beloved pass skin from that season: The Visitor.The Visitor was essentially the character who instigated Fortnite's original storyline when he rode in on the meteor in order to investigate the weird black hole in the middle of the island. Having such an important place in Fortnite lore has made the Visitor skin, which was available exclusively on the Season 4 battle pass, a particularly flex-worthy OG skin over time.The other two skins are a new remix of Teknique, from the original Season 4 battle pass, who really looks suspiciously like a new version of Aura; and a version of Omega, also from the battle pass, in the style of Oblivion. For a closer look at each of the skins, as well as every single other item in the Season 4 OG Pass, all you have to do is scroll down. Fortnite OG Season 4 ends on August 8.Beyond OG, Fortnite had another big launch today with the superhero-themed Chapter 6 Season 3. We've got all the details here.

Also, happy Switch 2 launch week to all those who celebrate! This week eager fans, us included, finally got their hands on the highly anticipated hybrid console from…Read more...
author: Claire Jackson, Ethan Gach, Carolyn Petit, and Zack Zwiezen

title: Wholesome Direct 2025 - everything announced at this year's cosy indie showcase
description: If you're the sort who just can't seem to resist the soothing rhythms of turnip planting and interior design, you've come to the right place. This year's Wholesome Direct - which marks the fifth anniversary of the showcase - has now aired, unleashing a fresh wave of cosy games to stick on your wishlists. We've got vending machine management, adorable puppies on spooking adventures, cheese-based puzzling, geckos, goats, seasonal cemetery exploration, and a whole lot more. So if that sounds like it might help sate your idyllic yearning, read on for all the big announcements from Wholesome Direct 2025. And for more indies, you can check out our round-up of this year's Day of the Devs showcase elsewhere. Read more
author: Matt Wales

title: Summer Game Fest June 2025: Everything announced

title: A Roman Sands RE:Build release date and a tease for a new edition of Paratopic is exactly what the doctor ordered
description: I've been excited about Roman Sands RE:Build since the moment I laid my eyes on it, particularly because it's from the same studio behind the ever-haunting Paratopic. Roman Sands just has a ridiculously strong art direction to it, very much one that could easily be dubbed Y2K, but I think more accurately should be seen as an evolution of the aesthetic/ era. Almost as if this is the direction it could have gone in. Read more
author: Oisin Kuhnke

title: Constance is a beautiful, hand-drawn metroidvania that actually has a release date
description: Now, I'm not naming any names here, but there's a certain hand-drawn metroidvania that everyone's a bit sick of waiting for by this point, and could really do with a release date. OK, fine, yes it's Hollow Knight: Silksong, and if those recent Steam backend updates mean anything, I expect it'll get some kind of update sometime in the next few days. In the meantime, here's Constance, also a hand-drawn metroidvania, that actually does have a release date. Read more
author: Oisin Kuhnke

title: Dangerous Animals, a giddy slasher where the knife is a shark
description: Australian director Sean Byrne is one of horror’s premiere mixologists. His debut, 2009’s The Loved Ones, meshed teen romance with gruesome Hostel-style extremism. 2015’s The Devil’s Candy put a heavy metal spin on the haunted-house romp. His new film, Dangerous Animals, in theaters now, raises a question no one was asking about a classic B-movie […]

title: How to rewind in Mario Kart World
description: Mario Kart World‘s rewind feature is quietly one of the racing game’s most useful features for learning how its new tricks, jumps, and grinds work. The Nintendo Switch 2 launch game sets you loose to discover rewind on your own, though, with no tutorial or anything explaining how the tool works or when you might […]

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 881
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. What time do you usually wake up in the morning? These days, 6 in the morning. Ideally my day would start off at 5:30, though. 2. How organized is your purse? It’s on the verge of haphazard, always, LOL! I mean, I can find the usual things I absolutely need – my phone, wallet, keys, medication, lipgloss. But do I find those things in an efficient manner? No. 3. If you could make one rule that everyone around you had to follow, what would it be? Make your deadlines. I can’t stand it when people are casual about due dates! 4. How do you feel about wearing makeup when it’s hot? I’ll do it, but I don’t like to do too many layers. I’m happy with cream[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 881 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 863
description: Tabs always said that in kitty modeling, the best defense is a good offense. If you just rest on your laurels, sooner or later a hungrier up-and-coming cat (or Australian Shepherd) will take what’s yours, and you won’t be walking the catwalk at feline fashion week anymore. Nope, if you’re lucky, you’ll get a page in the Petco catalog. Every once in a while Tabs went into kitty ninja mode, and instead of just patrolling the neighborhood, he conducted more advanced cat recon… He’d inspect the houses on the circle more closely to look for signs of canine or feline incursion. One day, he picked up a new cat’s scent around an air conditioning filter a couple houses down. He sniffed the area for a long time, gathering intelligence, and then used the data to compile a cat profile. According to Tabs, the new cat was a three-year-old male tabby with green eyes and a crooked tail… Moderate kitty modeling potential. Of course, he was added to the database. 🙂 Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict,[Continue reading...] The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 863 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
